actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 105-225.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 79.
Mr. Duncan moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works by unanimous consent
actions.text: Referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works by unanimous consent.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development

official_title: To designate the United States Courthouse located at 301 West Main Street in Benton, Illinois, as the "James L. Foreman United States Courthouse".

summary.text: Designates the U.S. Courthouse at 301 West Main Street, Benton, Illinois, as the James L. Foreman United States Courthouse.

titles.title: To designate the United States Courthouse located at 301 West Main Street in Benton, Illinois, as the "James L. Foreman United States Courthouse".
